meanings.definition: A feeling of extreme repugnance or aversion.
meanings.sent1: The sight of spiders fills me with abhorrence.
meanings.sent2: Her abhorrence towards violence is well-known.
meanings.sent3: Despite his abhorrence of vegetables, he tried to eat a salad.
meanings.sent4: The abhorrence towards injustice burned within her.
meanings.sent5: The abhorrence towards cruelty made her take a stand.

meanings.definition: The act or state of abhorring; hatred.
meanings.sent1: His abhorrence of lies led him to always speak the truth.
meanings.sent2: The abhorrence between the two rival gangs was palpable.
meanings.sent3: The cat's abhorrence of water was evident when it saw the bathtub.
meanings.sent4: The abhorrence in her eyes showed the depth of her feelings.
meanings.sent5: The abhorrence towards betrayal was etched on his face.
